content.question: Each of the following pairs of graphs represent the change in air pressure due to sound waves as a function of time at a single location. Which pair of waves, when combined, would result in a wave with a beat frequency of <math alttext="2 hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>Hz</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a pair of graphs, each showing a sinusoidal wave in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled 0. Each horizontal axis is labeled Time, in seconds, with the number 1 indicated toward the end of the axis. Each vertical axis is labeled Change in Pressure. The two waves have the same amplitude. The first wave has 3 peaks and one trough between 0 and 1 second. The second wave has peaks and two troughs between 0 and 1 second.
